definition: to boil (of liquid)/boiling hot/Get out!/Go away!/fuck off (rude)
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The teapot should be warmed by pouring in a little boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 应倒进一点滚开的水把茶壶烫热。

sentences.english: The glass will crack if you pour boiled water into it.
sentences.chinese: 一倒进去滚开水，这个玻璃杯就会破裂。

sentences.english: He kept on bothering me with silly questions that I told him to go fly a kite.
sentences.chinese: 他尽用些傻里傻气的问题来烦我，故此我叫他滚开。

sentences.english: You can from my world scram Mody.
sentences.chinese: 你可以从我的世界么滚开。

sentences.english: That's the biggest pile of bollocks I've ever heard.
sentences.chinese: 滚开，这是我听过最荒谬的事。

sentences.english: The teapot shall be warmed by pouring in a little boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 应倒进一点滚开的水把茶壶烫热。

sentences.english: I said you need to get out of here.
sentences.chinese: 我说了，你们两个快给我滚开。

definition: to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to get out of the way
to get out of the way/to step aside
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to refuse a toast only to be forced to drink a forfeit/fig. to hesitate to do sth until forced to do even more
pinyin: jing4 jiu3 bu4 chi1 chi1 fa2 jiu3
